resources.string: While the consequences could be bad, safe driving must always be a priority, and ideally the phone should be off from the start.
Since a distracted driver is a dangerous driver, keeping the phone off would definitely be the safest.
While this response appears correct given the situation, the real error lies in having the phone on while driving.
While driving, you receive a phone call, and you are currently expecting an important call from your boss. How do you respond?
1) Considering the consequences of not answering the call, you decide there is no choice but to answer
2) You make sure to keep the phone off for the duration of the ride, in order to avoid distractions.
3) Although the situation is distracting, you ignore the call as best as possible and try to concentrate on driving
